reviewText: I love this film. Originally watched when it was making the festival circuit. One of my favorites, bought it for my brother who is climbing Mt. Baker this summer.
This is a great video taking us back to the beginnings of the Mount Baker Club. Watched this at a friend"s house in Bellingham and just had to have my own copy!
Well paced account of a little-known distance race in 1911.  Compelling local history.
Excellent documentary.  Nominated for an Emmy.
Very fascinating and well-done.  I liked it, because a relative from a previous generation ran in this race and was a true mountain man.
Fantastic piece of history mixed with wonderful performances. Whether you're a fan of documentaries, running, or just good film you'll enjoy this title.

I saw this movie in the theater soon after it came out. This is such a wonderful look at a time in history when there was no equipment from REI.  This is worth seeing just to look at the "man against nature" scenes.  I am not going to do any spoilers here, but I will tell you that there are scenes in this movie that I will never forget.  One of them still makes my laugh then I remember it.  The filmmakers have a wonderful knack for telling a story with humor and with detail about a major historical event in the Pacific Northwest.  You won't regret buying this.
This really is a great documentary that tells a great story. A bit long at 1 1/2 hours but still worth watching.

This run was just attempted last month by some people from Bellingham and the weather ended up stopping them in their tracks.  Too bad.  Hopefully this run will be attempted again.

The originals must have been amazing men.

Mr. Warger did a great job on this little movie/documentary.
I viewed this at our local independent theater and bought the DVD as gifts for friends who enjoy running and are familiar with Bellingham.
